title: EduSpark Online Learning Platform UIUX Design
description:
EduSpark is an advanced online learning platform where students, mentors, and institutions connect in a seamless digital ecosystem. I was hired to design its full UI/UX experience – starting from user flows to final hi-fi prototypes using Figma.


The challenge was to maintain a clean yet modern look while catering to different user roles like Students, Instructors, and Admins. I developed over 25+ responsive screens including course listing, progress tracking dashboard, live session interface, and certification pages.


The design ensures accessibility with proper color contrast, keyboard navigation, and mobile-first responsiveness. The use of modular design components allowed for rapid development and easy future scaling.


I also created a design system with brand typography, color palette, reusable components, spacing guide, and iconography for the dev team to implement consistently.


Tools used: Figma, FigJam, Lucidchart


The client was thrilled with the clarity and usability, and the product received over 1,000 signups in the first week of soft launch.

title: FastFoodX – Restaurant Website with React & Tailwind
description:
FastFoodX is a fast-food chain in Bangladesh that wanted a sleek and modern online presence. I developed their full website using React, Tailwind CSS, and JSON-based content to ensure flexibility and performance.


The website includes interactive sections such as a real-time menu filtering system, online reservation form with validation, testimonials slider (with Swiper.js), a blog section, and image gallery with modal zoom features.


One of the unique aspects of the site is its seamless dark/light mode toggle and SEO-focused meta tag integration on every route using `react-helmet`. I also added AOS animation to enhance user interaction without sacrificing speed.


The entire website is fully responsive and tested across mobile, tablet, and desktop devices. I also integrated a Firebase backend for contact form storage and admin-only food item updates in the future roadmap.


The site was delivered ahead of deadline, and their online orders increased by 32% within two weeks of launch.

title: TravelBuddy – Mobile App for Budget Travelers
description:
TravelBuddy is a cross-platform travel app built using React Native for both Android and iOS users. It helps budget travelers discover local attractions, plan trips, and book stays and transport at the best prices.


My role involved building the entire frontend structure using functional components, `react-navigation`, `redux-toolkit`, and integrating third-party APIs for maps, flight search, and hotel booking.


The UI was built with a clean minimalist approach with region-based theme changes (dark/light), multi-language support (English & Bengali), and offline mode caching using AsyncStorage.


Users can create profiles, save destinations, add reviews, and get personalized suggestions. Push notifications and in-app messaging features were added for better engagement.


I worked closely with the backend team to optimize data fetching using Axios and reduce app load time by 40%.


The final build was deployed via Expo and the app received 4.8★ rating on Play Store with over 10,000 downloads in the first month.

title: GreenRoot – Minimalist Eco Brand Logo & Identity Design
description:
GreenRoot is a startup focused on promoting organic farming and eco-conscious lifestyle products. They approached me to create a logo and brand identity that reflects their sustainability goals while staying minimal and timeless.


The client specifically wanted a design that combined a plant leaf with geometric balance, avoiding typical 'eco' clichés. After sketching multiple concepts, the final logo was crafted using Adobe Illustrator with a focus on clean typography, monoline iconography, and a natural green color palette (#4CAF50 & #2E7D32).


The branding package included:
1. Primary + Secondary logo
2. Scalable icon version
3. Brand color palette
4. Typography guide
5. Print-ready assets (PDF, SVG, PNG)


I also delivered mockups for product packaging, letterhead, and business cards to ensure brand consistency.


The client loved the simplicity and uniqueness and is now using it across their social and product line. Feedback from their customers was overwhelmingly positive!

title: CryptoX – Animated Landing Page for Blockchain Startup
description:
CryptoX is a blockchain-based digital wallet startup targeting Gen-Z users. They needed a futuristic, animated landing page to promote their upcoming ICO launch. I built the entire landing experience using Vite + Tailwind CSS + GSAP to ensure fast performance and smooth scroll-based animations.


The landing page includes:

  • Hero section with animated SVG waves
  • Scroll-triggered token info and pricing animations
  • Real-time counter showing ICO progress (with dummy API)
  • Trust section with partner logos and testimonials
  • Newsletter signup with validation and Firebase integration

The site is fully responsive with a dark theme by default, using Tailwind’s `dark:` utilities and a toggle switch to change themes. I optimized assets and reduced page size to under 1.2MB for faster loading.


The client praised the speed, animation smoothness, and mobile experience. This project was later featured in a crypto design newsletter!

title: TaskPilot – SaaS Productivity Dashboard UI
description:
TaskPilot is a SaaS productivity tool for small teams, combining task management, calendar scheduling, and analytics. I was hired to design a complete dashboard UI that’s clean, scalable, and easy to navigate for non-tech users.


The dashboard features:

  • Overview panels with charts (designed for real-time data)
  • Drag-and-drop task board (Kanban-style)
  • Calendar integration with color-coded events
  • Collaboration tools (team chat, file upload UI)

I designed this in Figma using an 8pt grid, with consistent spacing, typography, and reusable components across 35+ screens. Light & dark themes were designed side by side to support user preferences.


I also created a design spec document and developer handoff using Figma’s inspect mode and interactive prototype. The client’s dev team delivered the MVP within 3 weeks of receiving my files, thanks to the modular design system I prepared.


This UI is now used by over 1,500 companies worldwide.
